query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 E già la vita di quel lume santo 8 rivolta s’era al Sol che la rïempie 9 come quel ben ch’a ogne cosa è tanto.
query.result:
**English:**
7 And already the life of that holy light 8 had turned to the Sun which fills it, 9 like that good which is so much to every thing.
**Sanskrit:**
7 Atha ca tasya dīpasya jīvitam 8 parāvṛttam āsīt sūryasya prati, yaḥ tam pūraṇam karoti, 9 yathā tat śubham yaḥ sarvasmai api bhūtāya bahutaram asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Ahi anime ingannate e fatture empie, 11 che da sì fatto ben torcete i cuori, 12 drizzando in vanità le vostre tempie!
13 Ed ecco un altro di quelli splendori 14 ver’ me si fece, e ’l suo voler piacermi 15 significava nel chiarir di fori.
query.result:
**English:**
10 Ah, deluded souls and wicked deeds, 11 that turn your hearts from such good, 12 directing your temples in vain!
13 And behold, another of those splendors 14 approached me, and his desire to please me 15 was evident in his shining countenance.
**Sanskrit:**
10 Aha mūḍhātmānaḥ pāpakarmāṇaśca, 11 ye asmāt śubhāt evam viparītayataḥ kurutha hṛdayāni, 12 mithyā pravṛttayataḥ śirasi.
13 Tataśca anyaḥ eṣām tejām̐śānām 14 mama prati ājagāma, tasya ca mama prīṇanaṃ kāmaḥ 15 sphuṭaḥ āsīt mukhasya prabhāyāṃ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 Li occhi di Bëatrice, ch’eran fermi 17 sovra me, come pria, di caro assenso 18 al mio disio certificato fermi.
query.result:
**English:**
16 The eyes of Beatrice, which were fixed 17 upon me, as before, with sweet assent 18 confirmed my desire.
**Sanskrit:**
16 Bēatrīcēḥ nayanaṃ, yat sthiraṃ āsīt 17 mama upari, yathā pūrvaṃ, priyasya anumater abhiyuktena 18 mama icchām niścitām cakāra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 «Deh, metti al mio voler tosto compenso, 20 beato spirto», dissi, «e fammi prova 21 ch’i’ possa in te refletter quel ch’io penso!».
query.result:
**English:**
19 "Oh, quickly grant my wish, 20 blessed spirit," I said, "and show me 21 that I can reflect in you what I think!"
**Sanskrit:**
19 "Dehi, me mati me icchāyāḥ kṣipram prāyaścittam, 20 bhagavān ātmā," iti ahaṃ, "evaṃ ca me darśaya 21 yathā aham tava madhye pratinididhyāsam yat aham cintāmi!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Onde la luce che m’era ancor nova, 23 del suo profondo, ond’ ella pria cantava, 24 seguette come a cui di ben far giova:
25 «In quella parte de la terra prava 26 italica che siede tra Rïalto 27 e le fontane di Brenta e di Piava,
28 si leva un colle, e non surge molt’ alto, 29 là onde scese già una facella 30 che fece a la contrada un grande assalto.
query.result:
**English:**
22 Where the light that was still new to me, 23 from its depth, where it first sang, 24 followed me as one who benefits from doing good:
25 "In that part of the wicked land 26 of Italy that sits between Rialto 27 and the springs of the Brenta and the Piave,
28 a hill rises, and it does not rise very high, 29 from where a torch once descended 30 that made a great assault on the region.
**Sanskrit:**
22 Yatra prakāśaḥ yaḥ me adhunā api navaḥ āsīt, 23 tasya gambhīrāt, yataḥ sa pūrvam gāyati sma, 24 anugataḥ yathā yasya śubham kartaṃ prayojanam asti:
25 Tasmin deśe asya pṛthivyāḥ durācāraḥ 26 yatīyaḥ yaḥ sthitaḥ asti Rialto-madhye 27 evaṃ Brenta-Piava-nāmakayoḥ nadyoḥ udgama-sthānayoh madhye,
28 ekaḥ parvataḥ utthitaḥ asti, na ca sa ati-utkṛṣṭaḥ utthitaḥ asti, 29 tataḥ pūrvam ekaḥ daṇḍaḥ avatīrṇaḥ āsīt 30 yaḥ tena deśena saha mahatīm āhatim cakāra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Di questa luculenta e cara gioia 38 del nostro cielo che più m’è propinqua, 39 grande fama rimase; e pria che moia,
40 questo centesimo anno ancor s’incinqua: 41 vedi se far si dee l’omo eccellente, 42 sì ch’altra vita la prima relinqua.
query.result:
**English:**
37 Of this resplendent and dear joy 38 of our heaven, which is nearest to me, 39 great fame remained; and before it dies,
40 this hundredth year is still renewed: 41 see if a man should make himself excellent, 42 so that the first life may leave the other behind.
**Sanskrit:**
37 Asyāḥ prakāśamānāyāḥ priyāyāśca nandanaśriyāḥ 38 asmadīya-svargasya yā mama ati-samipe vartate, 39 mahat kīrtiḥ sthitā; mriyate ca pūrvam,
40 ayam śatatamaḥ varṣaḥ api punar navaḥ sampadyate: 41 paśya kim puruṣeṇa śreṣṭhatvam kartavyam, 42 yathā prathamam jīvitam dvitīyam jīvitam parityajet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Piangerà Feltro ancora la difalta 53 de l’empio suo pastor, che sarà sconcia 54 sì, che per simil non s’entrò in malta.
query.result:
**English:**
52 Feltro will weep again for the lack 53 of its wicked shepherd, who will be so disgraceful 54 that no one like him has ever entered the ditch.
**Sanskrit:**
52 Feltro punar roṣyati viyogāt 53 tasya durātmanaḥ pālakasya, yaḥ bhaviṣyati ghaṇapāpī 54 yathā tādṛśaḥ na praveśitaḥ khaṇḍe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 Troppo sarebbe larga la bigoncia 56 che ricevesse il sangue ferrarese, 57 e stanco chi ’l pesasse a oncia a oncia,
58 che donerà questo prete cortese 59 per mostrarsi di parte; e cotai doni 60 conformi fieno al viver del paese.
query.result:
**English:**
55 Too large would be the vat 56 that could hold the blood of Ferrara, 57 and he who weighed it ounce by ounce would grow weary,
58 which this courteous priest will give 59 to show himself a partisan; and such gifts 60 will be in keeping with the life of the region.
**Sanskrit:**
55 Ati vistīrṇo bhavet kuṇḍaḥ 56 yaḥ pratigṛhṇīyāt raktam vaidarbham, 57 śrāntaśca yaḥ tam tulyeta palitaḥ palitaḥ,
58 yaṃ dāsyaḥ ayam upacāraparaḥ 59 pakṣapātitvam darśayitum; tādṛśāni dānāni ca 60 anurūpāṇi bhavanti deśasya jīvanāya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Sù sono specchi, voi dicete Troni, 62 onde refulge a noi Dio giudicante; 63 sì che questi parlar ne paion buoni».
query.result:
**English:**
61 Up there are mirrors, you say Thrones, 62 where God judging shines upon us; 63 so that these words seem good to us.
**Sanskrit:**
61 Upari santi darpaṇāḥ, yān Troni-rūpeṇa vadatha, 62 yatra asmān nyāyādhipatiḥ Devaḥ prakāśate; 63 yataḥ ete kathāḥ asmākam śubhāḥ pratibhānti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 Qui si tacette; e fecemi sembiante 65 che fosse ad altro volta, per la rota 66 in che si mise com’ era davante.
query.result:
**English:**
64 Here he fell silent; and he made it seem to me 65 that he had turned to something else, because of the wheel 66 on which he had set himself as he was before.
**Sanskrit:**
64 Iha maunaṃ babhūva; cakāra ca me bhāvaṃ 65 anyatra vṛttaḥ, rathacakrahetoḥ, 66 yasminn āsīnaḥ pūrvavad eva.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 L’altra letizia, che m’era già nota 68 per cara cosa, mi si fece in vista 69 qual fin balasso in che lo sol percuota.
query.result:
**English:**
67 The other joy, which was already known to me 68 as a dear thing, appeared to me 69 like a false beacon in which the sun strikes.
**Sanskrit:**
67 Anyā sā prītir yā mayā pūrvam eva jñātā āsīt 68 Priyāyai vastave, mayi adarśata 69 Yathā mithyā-dīpaḥ yasmin sūryaḥ praharati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Per letiziar là sù fulgor s’acquista, 71 sì come riso qui; ma giù s’abbuia 72 l’ombra di fuor, come la mente è trista.
query.result:
**English:**
70 Up there, joy is acquired through radiance, 71 just as laughter is here; but down below, 72 the shadow outside darkens, just as the mind is sad.
**Sanskrit:**
70 Tatra prasādanāya tejas tulyam upajāyate, 71 Yathātra hāsyam; adhaḥ tu nirastaḥ 72 Bahirdhābhāvaḥ andhakāraḥ iva yadā cittaṃ viṣādamayam bhavati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 «Dio vede tutto, e tuo veder s’inluia», 74 diss’ io, «beato spirto, sì che nulla 75 voglia di sé a te puot’ esser fuia.
query.result:
**English:**
73 "God sees all, and your sight is hidden in Him," 74 I said, "blessed spirit, so that no 75 desire of yours can be hidden from Him.
**Sanskrit:**
73 Devaḥ sarvam paśyati, tava ca darśanam tasmin līyate, 74 uvāca aham, "śubhātmā, yatas tvayi 75 na kaścid api kāmaḥ svayam prakāśate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Dunque la voce tua, che ’l ciel trastulla 77 sempre col canto di quei fuochi pii 78 che di sei ali facen la coculla,
79 perché non satisface a’ miei disii? 80 Già non attendere’ io tua dimanda, 81 s’io m’intuassi, come tu t’inmii».
query.result:
**English:**
76 Therefore, your voice, which delights heaven 77 always with the song of those most pious fires 78 that make a cowl with six wings,
79 why does it not satisfy my desires? 80 I would not await your question, 81 if I understood myself, as you understand me.
**Sanskrit:**
76 Tasmāt tava vāṇī, yā svargam ānandayati 77 sadā gānena teṣām pavitrāṇām agnīnam 78 ye ṣaḍbhiḥ pakṣaiḥ kuṇḍalam kurvanti,
79 kimartham na pūrṇayati mama icchān? 80 Na aham tava praśnam pratikṣeyam, 81 yadi aham ātmānam jānīyām, yathā tvam māṃ jānāsi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 «La maggior valle in che l’acqua si spanda», 83 incominciaro allor le sue parole, 84 «fuor di quel mar che la terra inghirlanda,
85 tra ’ discordanti liti contra ’l sole 86 tanto sen va, che fa meridïano 87 là dove l’orizzonte pria far suole.
query.result:
**English:**
82 "The greatest valley into which water spreads," 83 his words then began, 84 "outside of that sea which garlands the earth,
85 between the conflicting shores against the sun 86 it goes so far that it makes a meridian 87 where the horizon used to rise before.
**Sanskrit:**
82 "Yaḥ paramaḥ khaṇḍaḥ yasmin jalam viṣṭabhyate," 83 evam tadā ārabdhāḥ āsya vacaḥ, 84 "tasmāt samudrāt yaḥ pṛthivīm āvṛṇoti,
85 vivadantīṣu tīreṣu sūryasya pratipakṣe 86 tāvatyāvad gacchati yāvat madhyāhnaṃ karoti 87 tatra yatra pūrvam udayācalaḥ abhavat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 Di quella valle fu’ io litorano 89 tra Ebro e Macra, che per cammin corto 90 parte lo Genovese dal Toscano.
query.result:
**English:**
88 Of that valley I was a native, 89 between Ebro and Macra, which by a short course 90 divides the Genoese from the Tuscan.
**Sanskrit:**
88 Tasyāḥ upatyakāyāḥ aham āsām asmi, 89 Ebro ca Macrā ca madhye, yaḥ alpaḥ pathaḥ 90 Genovesam Tuṣkāraḥ vibhajati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 Ad un occaso quasi e ad un orto 92 Buggea siede e la terra ond’ io fui, 93 che fé del sangue suo già caldo il porto.
query.result:
**English:**
91 At a sunset and at a sunrise 92 Buggea sits and the land from which I came, 93 which once made its harbor warm with its blood.
**Sanskrit:**
91 Ekasmin astage evaikasmin udaye ca 92 Buggea āsīnaḥ asti, sā ca pṛthivī yataḥ aham āgataḥ, 93 yā pūrvaṃ svakena raktena uṣṇam akārṣīt tadīyaṃ nāvikāśrayam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Non però qui si pente, ma si ride, 104 non de la colpa, ch’a mente non torna, 105 ma del valor ch’ordinò e provide.
query.result:
**English:**
103 But here one does not repent, but laughs, 104 not of the sin, which does not come to mind, 105 but of the valor that ordained and provided.
**Sanskrit:**
103 Na tu atra paścāttāpaḥ, kim tu hasanam eva, 104 Na pāpāt, yat manaḥi na pratyāgacchati, 105 Kim tu śaur yāt, yat niyojayām āsa ca prayacchat ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Qui si rimira ne l’arte ch’addorna 107 cotanto affetto, e discernesi ’l bene 108 per che ’l mondo di sù quel di giù torna.
query.result:
**English:**
106 Here one gazes again at the art that adorns 107 so much affection, and discerns the good 108 for which the world above returns to the world below.
**Sanskrit:**
106 Atra punaravalokayati kalāyām yā bhūṣayati 107 Tāvān snehaḥ, ca vijānāti śubham 108 Yena lokaḥ ūrdhvaḥ adhaḥsthitaṃ punar āgacchati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Ma perché tutte le tue voglie piene 110 ten porti che son nate in questa spera, 111 proceder ancor oltre mi convene.
query.result:
**English:**
109 But why do you bear all your desires fulfilled 110 that were born in this sphere, 111 for it is necessary for me to proceed even further.
**Sanskrit:**
109 Kimartham tvam sarvāḥ kāmān pūrṇān 110 bibharṣi ye jāṭāḥ asmin jagati, 111 aparam api mām agrataḥ pravṛttam āvaśyakam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Tu vuo’ saper chi è in questa lumera 113 che qui appresso me così scintilla 114 come raggio di sole in acqua mera.
query.result:
**English:**
112 You want to know who is in this light 113 that here beside me sparkles so 114 like a ray of sun in pure water.
**Sanskrit:**
112 Tvam vettuṃ icchasi kaḥ asti asmin prakāśe 113 yaḥ atra mama sānnidhye evam prakāśate 114 yathā sūryakiraṇaḥ nirmale jale.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Or sappi che là entro si tranquilla 116 Raab; e a nostr’ ordine congiunta, 117 di lei nel sommo grado si sigilla.
query.result:
**English:**
115 Now know that Rahab is tranquil there, 116 and joined to our order, 117 in the highest grade of which she is sealed.
**Sanskrit:**
115 Ata eva jānīhi yatra tāṃ śāntām 116 Rābam, asmābhiḥ saha yuktām, 117 asmākaṃ śreṣṭhe pade mudritām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Da questo cielo, in cui l’ombra s’appunta 119 che ’l vostro mondo face, pria ch’altr’ alma 120 del trïunfo di Cristo fu assunta.
query.result:
**English:**
118 From this heaven, where the shadow ends 119 that your world makes, before any other soul 120 was assumed to the triumph of Christ.
**Sanskrit:**
118 Asmāt svargāt, yasmin chayā niścityate 119 yā yuşmākam lokam karoti, pūrvaṃ yāvad anyā ātmā 120 Khristasya vijaye abhyudgatā āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 Ben si convenne lei lasciar per palma 122 in alcun cielo de l’alta vittoria 123 che s’acquistò con l’una e l’altra palma,
124 perch’ ella favorò la prima gloria 125 di Iosüè in su la Terra Santa, 126 che poco tocca al papa la memoria.
query.result:
**English:**
121 It was fitting that she should leave him for a palm 122 in some heaven of the high victory 123 that she acquired with one palm and the other,
124 because she favored the first glory 125 of Joshua in the Holy Land, 126 which the pope scarcely remembers.
**Sanskrit:**
121 Tasyāḥ śreṣṭhatāṃ prāptavān aham tāḍitaraṇena 122 kvacit svarge uttamāyāḥ vijayasyāḥ 123 yāṃ prāpayām āsa tāḍitaraṇadvayena,
124 yataḥ sā prathamajayaṃ prīṇayām āsa 125 Yehośūʿasya puṇyabhūmau, 126 yāṃ smaraṇe pope nāsti kiṃcid api.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 La tua città, che di colui è pianta 128 che pria volse le spalle al suo fattore 129 e di cui è la ’nvidia tanto pianta,
130 produce e spande il maladetto fiore 131 c’ha disvïate le pecore e li agni, 132 però che fatto ha lupo del pastore.
query.result:
**English:**
127 Your city, which is the seedbed of him 128 who first turned his back on his Maker 129 and of whom envy is so deeply sown,
130 produces and spreads the accursed flower 131 that has led astray the sheep and the lambs, 132 because it has turned the shepherd into a wolf.
**Sanskrit:**
127 Tava nagarī, yā tasya bījam asti 128 yaḥ pūrvam svakartuḥ pratimukham cakāra 129 yasya ca īrṣyā tivratayā ropitā asti,
130 utpādayati vistārayati ca śaptam puṣpam 131 yat aviśiṣṭān paśūn agnīñ ca viprakṛṣṭavan, 132 yataḥ paśupālakasya vṛkam cakāra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 Per questo l’Evangelio e i dottor magni 134 son derelitti, e solo ai Decretali 135 si studia, sì che pare a’ lor vivagni.
query.result:
**English:**
133 For this reason, the Gospel and the great doctors 134 are abandoned, and only the Decretals 135 are studied, so that they seem to them living lights.
**Sanskrit:**
133 Asmāt kāraṇāt Evaṃgēlyaṃ ca mahāntasca vaidyakāḥ 134 parityaktāḥ santi, Decrētālibhyaḥ eva 135 adhyayanaṃ kriyate, yathā teṣāṃ jīvantyaḥ pradīpāḥ iva pratibhānti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 A questo intende il papa e ’ cardinali; 137 non vanno i lor pensieri a Nazarette, 138 là dove Gabrïello aperse l’ali.
query.result:
**English:**
136 To this the pope and cardinals aspire; 137 their thoughts do not go to Nazareth, 138 where Gabriel opened his wings.
**Sanskrit:**
136 Asminneva prayatnaste pāpaḥ kardinalāśca, 137 Na teṣāṃ manāṃsi gacchanti Nāzāretam, 138 Yatra Gabrīyelaḥ pakṣau vivṛte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 Ma Vaticano e l’altre parti elette 140 di Roma che son state cimitero 141 a la milizia che Pietro seguette,
142 tosto libere fien de l’avoltero».
query.result:
**English:**
139 But the Vatican and the other parts chosen 140 of Rome that have been a cemetery 141 for the soldiery that Peter follows,
142 will soon be free from the adulterer.
**Sanskrit:**
139 Api tu Vātikānaḥ anyāśca pradhānāḥ bhāgāḥ 140 Romasya ye santu śmaśānāḥ 141 tasya sainye yasya netā asti Pitṛ,
142 te sarve śīghram eva muktāḥ bhavisyanti vyabhicārāt.
